reviews_data.review_text: I like the library but I wish it had cafe or restaurant and a YA section
The facilities are very clean.  But the staff are too noisy. They seem to have forgotten that this is a library.
Love this library the best and the quaint area it's in.
They have a variety of book options and they employees give off great energy and are sweet people
We love this library! The staff are always helpful and so kind to our kids.
Terrible storytime! They wouldn't let my girls enter. We had to have a ticket in advance. This is a very bad setup and made my girls cry. Thanks a lot, Pineville Library. Not family oriented.

The storytime is a joke. It is completely full on Saturdays and you have to get at ticket 30 min prior to have a seat. My son was very disappointed watching everyone else enter Storytime. Very poor organization. Offer a larger room or more sessions. 0/10.
Beautiful, friendly, relaxing, always great for kids

I went there with my niece to do a program, and they were as rude as they could be.  She was crying because they were so awful to us!  Shame on you!  Maybe get some manners when you speak to people...
Such great staff, and well-stocked library.
what a wonderful library. very spacious and one floor

This library is great! It's clean, the staff is friendly, and I love using the CML app to reserve and pick up books hassle-free. They even transfer books from other locations. Overall, it's been a fantastic experience.
Great space! From the outside it does not look like the typical library. I requested a study room, the staff were accommodating and helpful.

Worst staff. This is not a library, it's a party place. Staffs are playing with puzzles, too noisy, talking for the whole time. Wen can't even focus on reading or studying. Worst library staffs I've ever met.

Pinevilel Library, I've been coming to this library for a little over a month, I usually book a study room so I can focus and not have any distractions. I've never had an issue and I love the facility...However, all of a sudden, in the past two days, 2 employees have  walked in my room and turned the lights all the way up. I know this doesn't sound like a big problem but I have sensory issues and all my work is on a computer and bright lights are very distracting and cause glare on my screen also gives me a migraine very quickly which is hence why I even book a private room. I have not found a on paper rule saying that it's an actual policy to have the lights at a certian brightness. A staff member in fact only said it's a "preference" for them. I even said okay and left the lights on a very dim setting and they still come right in and turn them up. I'm really about to stop coming to this library because like I said I come to focus and I really can't work with the lights on. The doors are all glass and so much light already comes in and they can see me just fine. Again I know it sounds like a small thing but for someone who is quiet sensitive to light and has to stare at a computer screen as is, it literally leads me to sensory overload which makes it hard to focus, and my eyes want to go straight to the lights, also causing migraines which eventually leads to physically feeling sick and all this stemming from just a bright light that I truly don't understand why it's an issue.

I really did like this library, but it shouldn't be a big deal for those who have private study areas to leave the lights off or very low. Especially considering everyone is different and could have different conditions that within reason should be easily accommodated. I'm autistic and also have an eye condition that causes me to percieve light differently (kind of brighter and more scattered) also making me more sensitive. And the staff didn't ask if there's a reason or anything they just walk in and say "I'm turning this up okay bye."

Please don't get me wrong, I really liked this library but I'm starting to get frustrated.

The employees are so nice and friendly. They were very sweet to my children and catering. I used a study room for work and it was peace and quiet. This is an awesome library. Cozy for the adults and the kids.
Wonderful and helpful staff. Nice collections of kids books
Awesome staff that's VERY friendly & helpful. The facility itself was amazing as well. Do yourself a favor and visit this local library!

The new Pineville location for Charlotte Mecklenburg Library is an awesome place! You'll find plenty of seating, organized bookshelves, a lot of clean space, and much more. If you need to use a computer, there are a number of computer desks with Dell PCs. Just get your free library card to access the computers and internet. There's also free internet and free faxing. If you need assistance, there are at least two desk receptionists to help you. For families, you'll also notice a kids section, and you can view the weekly story time schedules online.

This is a large space with over 18,000 square feet. Check out the calendar on the Charlotte Mecklenburg Library website for information about all types of events.

This library is a great space and a welcome addition to the Pineville and south Charlotte communities!
Another library with a children's section saturated with political agenda. We won't be back.
Great

Really nice ambiance, lot of natural light. Study rooms and teens area. I will  need to come back again to explore more. The county put in a good amount of effort. Kids loved face painting, magic show on opening day..
Excellent place to visit. All in one town.
Glad to be the first reviewer of a new library

Amazing place!
Lots of books, movies, comics, DVDs.
Multiple computer stations.
Print station with pay station attached.
Great staff: Chad and Kate are knowledgeable and hilarious. They shall be a great asset to the team. The decor was color-coded by section. I believe Blue is for children and Green was is Teen section. The floor and the ceiling pattern have history coordination as well. Also, the welcome brochure matches the color codes of the library which is genius 
They will have writing programs, rental opportunities(remember, it's a PUBLIC library so anyone can venture into your section)
Vending
Meeting room
Kitchen
Etc.
I could say more, but you just need to check it out!
